name.str: Tales of a Junktown Jerky Vendor
name.str_pl: Tales of a Junktown Jerky Vendor

description: A book of stories from a fictional apocalyptic town. In between the anecdotes are some actually good tips on running a business, and some recipes for 'iguana'...
The Boy Scout's handbook, 2077 edition. Contains information useful in wilderness survival, including a few melee weapons, and the 'Survival Quesidilla'!

A design document full of the basic Gun Runner loads of ammunition. This was released to the general public shortly before the Cataclysm,as a publicity stunt. Now you too can make bullets like a professional!
A book of DIY weapon projects, endorsed by the government to help every citizen be knowledgable 'at a moments notice.'
The AntAgonizer, an antihero comic from Hubris Comics. The authors worked tirelessly to keep designs as realistically as possible.
Grognak the Barbarian and the Jungle of the Bat Babies. Violent, brutal, and... utterly fun.
Hell's Chain Gang, by Hubris Comics. Full of improvised weapons based off those real POWs used to escape Chinese POW camps.
When evil walks the streets of Boston, one man lurks in the shadows. Shielding the innocent. Judging the guilty. That guardian is... the Silver Shroud! Published by Hubris Comics.
A comic about a hero with oceanic superpowers and swimming skill. Criminally underrated to some, to others absolutely horrible
A popular book from the pre-cataclysm days, this book contains several guides to nuclear powered gadgets, all without the use of a transistor! Sponsored by Radiation King.

A popular book from the pre-cataclysm days, this book contains several guides to nuclear powered gadgets, all without the use of a transistor! The limited Vault Boy edition has illustrations featuring everyone's favorite Vault Dweller, and a couple bonus recipes for the Vault Mechanics out there.
Everything you need to know about robots, turrets, and even computers. The writings pretty dry, though.

name.str: Zen and the Art of Piloting
name.str_pl: Zen and the Art of Piloting

description: An essential book on driving, while also giving some deep insight on Zen philosophy. Reading this should help you keep your cool while driving.
Impress your friends and colleagues with this easy how-to guide to traps and antipersonnel devices. Great Fun!

The Wasteland Survival Guide, by Moira Brown. While seemingly written by a lunatic before the cataclysm, surprisingly, a lot of things in this book are accurate to today's predicament. Its also full of great hand-drawn diagrams, so even a mole rat could understand whats happening in it!
A super-hero comic from Mexico. Its all in spanish...

An old pulp magazine about police exploits. The highly editorialized stories in this issue include 'Shoot to Kill' by Alan Kastin, 'Shootout with a Chem-Crazy Dame', and 'Eight Bullets, Ten crooks'. This magazine hasn't been printed since the early 2000s due to sensitive subject matter, and moral guardians. You're holding a piece of pop culture history.
A super-hero comic, based around the exploits of the team known as The Unstoppables. The hero team includes The Silver Shroud, Manta-Man, and of course, Grognak himself.
A comic based around sci fi horror stories. In this issue, stories include... Dead rising from their graves, Mushroom Men, and a blob eating everything... Yeesh.
A popular young boy's comic series which features outlandish melee feats from knights of yore. Stories include 'The Greatest Crusade' and 'Quest of the Golden Chalice'.
An exciting bi-yearly magazine about boxing exploits. There's also small sections about wrestling, kickboxing, and MMA.
This book doesn't feel right... It seems to be a holy book, but you can't pronounce most of the words... Its surprisingly heavy.
Well, THIS would have been good to have at the beginning of the goddamn game. Wait, wrong game. Still, theres some funny stuff in here. And a lot of cut content.

A printed copy of the Fallout Bible by Chris Avellone. A mix between a definitive, unambigous guide to Fallout lore, and an extended Q&A session with fans, its technically noncanon because of a change in developers, but who cares? This lore is a lot better.
A biography of the Masticator, New Reno's greatest boxer. It covers his style of fighting in great detail.
A complete guide to Arroyo Style combat.

name.str: Tales of a Klamath Gecko Hunter
name.str_pl: Tales of a Klamath Gecko Hunter

description: A complete guide to Gecko Hunting.
This, uh, cat fancier's magazine has no redeeming value. You'll learn nothing of use to you in the wastes when you read about...cats.
